moves.6. Bg5: i don't do that usually. I guess i was pointing for a draw
moves.6... h6 7. Bd2 Nc6 8. d5 Ne7 9. Bd3 e5 1: until then, if he had offered me the draw, i think i would have accepted.
moves.20. Nh4 f5 21. f4: after i played this i really thought: "did i make a mistake?" I wanted to open the space to his king. Most of his pieces were looking to my queen size or were blocked: see the two knights! But on the other way, i was exposing my pieces to the pawns ant the black bishop on g7.
moves.21... cxb4 22. axb4 exf4: here is the black bishop and my queen is overcharged.
moves.23. exf5: so i decided to bet on the loss of my black bishop in exchange of the attack on g6.
moves.24. Nxf5 fxe3 25. Nxe3: and so... no benefits... as it seems...
moves.25... a6 26. Rc2 h5 27. Ne4: but, as you left me most of my pieces, they will attack on your king side
moves.27... Bh6 28. Qe1 Qd7 29. Rf2 Rxf2 30. Q: And now I have a powerful attack. I thought I had the lead here
moves.33. Rf1 Rb8 34. Ngf6+ Nxf6 35. Qxf6: i really hesitated the 34-35 moves, but I haven't found the clue. Then I realized my main attack had to be a diversion for a fight on queen side.
moves.36. Qxg7+:
why not Kxd6? because 
35.	Qxf6	Rb7
36.	Nxd6	Nxd6
37.	Qxd6	Qd4+ and the bishop falls
moves.36... Kxg7 37. c5: and here is my attack on queen side
moves.37... Be3+ 38. Kg2 bxc5 39. bxc5 Bxc5: i had preferred to keep my knight here, if he had taken with the pawn, but still haven't seen wrong
moves.40. Nxc5 dxc5 41. Bxa6 Rc7 42. Kg3: and now i made a terrible mistake... somewhere here. I am very sad because i had a strong attack, at least to force the draw... And now I lose.
moves.43... c4: because of this of course. Anyway, pangli defended correctly, and I am not sure i had a true attack, conclusive, etc. I should have proponed the draw two moves sooner
